title: Prohibits the sale, rental or display of indecent material within 200 feet of a school or place of worship
summary: Prohibits any person, firm, or corporation from selling, offering for sale, renting, offering to rent, or displaying indecent material within two hundred feet of any public or private primary or secondary school, church, synagogue, or other place of worship.

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2108

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the general business law, in relation to prohibiting the
sale or rental of indecent material near a school or place of worship

PURPOSE:
To prohibit the sale or rental of indecent
materials, as
defined in the penal law, within 200 feet of a school or place of
worship.

SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:
The bill amends the general
business law by
adding a section which makes it unlawful for any person, firm or
corporation to sell, offer for sale, rent, offer to rent, or display
indecent material, as defined in section 235.21 of the penal law,
within 200 feet of any public or private primary or secondary school,
church, synagogue, or other place of worship.

EXISTING LAW:
The bill amends the general business
law by adding a new
section 397-a. Currently, no such prohibition exists.

JUSTIFICATION:
Under section 235.21 of the penal law,
it is already a
crime to distribute indecent material to minors. In keeping with the
law's attempt to keep harmful material away from minors, this bill
would prevent their sale, rental, or display within 200 feet of
schools and places of worship. That children on their way to these
places, which offer enlightenment and uplift, must encounter such
materials and the establishments which peddle them is unfortunate,
unseemly, and potentially damaging.

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
None.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
This act shall take effect on the
first of September
next succeeding the date on which it shall have become a law.
